summary: User requested support for countWorkflowExecutions API in the TypeScript SDK to check if a workflow execution exists. The issue was resolved by using the alternative getHandle().describe() approach with status checking.
userImpact: Users need a convenient way to check if a workflow execution exists or is running without implementing complex search queries.
rootCause: The TypeScript SDK does not provide a high-level API for countWorkflowExecutions; users must use raw gRPC API which requires Elasticsearch and proper query syntax.
proposedFix: Provide a high-level SDK method wrapping countWorkflowExecutions similar to listWorkflowExecutions, or document the workaround using getHandle(workflowId).describe().
workaround: Use client.getHandle(workflowId).describe() and check status code for WORKFLOW_EXECUTION_STATUS_RUNNING to determine if workflow is executing.
resolutionDetails: Issue resolved through discussion; user found that getHandle(workflowId).describe() is the appropriate approach for checking workflow execution status in the SDK.
keyQuote: this.client.getHandle(workflowId).describe() - This is working great, thanks for your help!
